content: silky scallops lace scarf knit this simple lace scarf with schulana mosco for plenty of subtle shimmer and drape features a garter stitch edge biased to the right materials 1-2 balls schulana mosco us size 7 needles gauge 7 st and 9 row = 1 in lace pattern finished measurements 4 x40 unblocked with one ball of yarn 4 x60 unblocked with 2 balls pattern co 28 stitches knit 4 row for garter stitch border begin lace pattern refer to chart below if desired for the body of the scarf you will be knitting a 4-stitch garter stitch border on each edge and two repeats of the lace pattern for the front row and all purls between 4-stitch garter stitch border for the back row lace pattern row row 1 k4 *yo k8 k2tog* repeat between * and * once k4 row 2 k4 p20 k4 row 3 k4 *k1 yo k7 k2tog* repeat once k4 row 4 repeat row 2 row 5 k4 *k2 yo k6 k2tog* repeat once k4 row 6 repeat row 2 row 7 k4 *k3 yo k5 k2tog* repeat once k4 row 8 repeat row 2 row 9 k4 *k4 yo k4 k2tog* repeat once k4 row 10 repeat row 2 row 11 k4 *k5 yo k3 k2tog* repeat once k4 row 12 repeat row 2 row 13 k4 *k6 yo k2 k2tog* repeat once k4 row 14 repeat row 2 row 15 k4 *k7 yo k1 k2tog* repeat once k4 row 16 repeat row 2 row 17 k4 *k8 yo k2tog* repeat once k4 row 18 repeat row 2 lace chart continue knitting these 18 row until scarf reaches desired length one ball of schulana mosco will make a 40 long scarf unblocked blocking will add about 4-6 knit 4 row for garter stitch border bind off on the 4th garter stitch row wrong side block with warm iron over a wet cotton cloth to desired length enjoy your scarf © 2011 by joan neumiller designed for lila and claudine s
